10/10 peak anime.
K Is My Favorite Anime Everrrrrrr.

The recent Scar of the Praeter and the older "Hand shakers" took a turn for the worse.

The animation aren't as smooth as this, the story's getting no where. They don't feel as grounded as this. Though "W'Z" the sequel to "Hand Shakers" did redeem it, "Scar of the Praeter" took a different turn.

The over exaggerated smoke and dust effects, the baby big eyed characters, the unnatural backgrounds, the unpronounced character lines, the Fight scenes, the characters. Like, how?!

K, looking back on it look so different. Everything seemed natural (Ehem, except for the panty shots. They got..emm, A little bit overboard there along with the boob physics.) But nevertheless, that anime was so far ahead with its Story line, the pacing was just so UNREAL even for an Anime, the character plot twists and turns. The Animations and Fight scenes, the atmosphere, EVERYTHING (Except for the boob physics and panty shots.) Was just so GREAT. but the anime was also underrated and not as known as most animes of its time. Kind of like "Hitori no Outcast." 


I wish Go Hands Studios would create an Anime of the same quality as K.

Nowdays, the only anime from the studio which I truly have fun with is "Setoukai Yaquindome" (Idk if that's the right spelling.)


Eeeeeeeey YEP. That very anime is animated by the very same studio as this Master piece. No wonder the animation was so Smooth.
he sounds like. eiji or ash from bananafish.

great graphics but the show at the beginning is confusing as hell. No explanation what in gods name is going on and while I understand it is suppose to be that you learn with the MC the problem comes that you have literally no idea what the fucks going on and while I don't want to know everything that is going on one important thing for someone to know when watching a show like this where the fights are between people who use a power it is insanely important to as quickly as possible explain what this power is, what it can do, how people have it, and its limits but no all we get is that these powers are bestowed to people by Kings but other then that all we get to see are different colors flames more or less and we don't really get a gauge as to what is powerful or how to determine if someone is considered powerful. It really makes the fight not as epic as you have no idea what is going on and who is winning or what kind of power they have. Another thing is the mind fuck that is how people react to these people with power and the thing is they don't. They just don't know what is going on and we don't get a explanation of this at first I mean someone literally miss hears someone saying that they are going to go kill someone (deliver their death warrant) as they are going to return a wallet to them.... and the same person who is like a close friend to the MC forgets who he is and for some reason the MC doesn't appear to be on the schools database, it is just so confusing (now I am only just over halfway through the first season at this point so I have no idea if they go into any detail but to be this far into a show and to not even explain the kind of power people are using is really bad)

Must watch movie 
Thankyou Satoshi kon

Inside of my dreams Paprika, vivid, cheeky, beautiful, slides between the buildings and corners of a night Tokyo following the beat of Susumu Hirasawa's melody.
I love her. She's definitely not the same of the novel that Satoshi Kon decided to adapt, and thank God.
Like him. I'd wish I could take her hand and slip through the cracks of time, surfing the skies of the impossible, diving the oceans of surreality, travelling into alternative universes of double identities, nightmare creatures and epic adventures...
until we come out from the movie projector, come into the screen and be cheered by Satoshi Kon with that mischievous smile of him from the seats, together with his friends Mima, Chiyoko, the trio Gin, Hana and Miyuki...

This is why I'd wish to see him, and not dead by the cancer.
I hope someday they finish Kon's Dreaming Machine film. Or adapt his manga 'Opus' into a tv series. R.i.p Satoshi Kon

Brilliant film, like all of Satoshi Kon's works.  He left us at 47.  Just imagine all the great works of art we'll never get because of that. So heartbreaking.

I heard that just before Kon died, he was working on a film called "Dream Machine". 
The concept art looked REALLY good, its a shame the movie was never completed...
One of the best animes to me.  Great piece, the late Satoshi Kon left this for the world.

That actually sounds pretty grounded for a Satoshi Kon movie. I mean, this guy is known for psychedelic movies like Perfect Blue, paprika and paranoia agent. Cannot imagine a grounded movie from him, but I guess I will see when Netflix has it available soon
and Satoshi Kon

91 Days is one of the Best Anime ever made , so underrated
Name song crundyroll? 91 days

In all seriousness, even if you hate the state that anime has become today this show warrants a watch. It lacks all the annoying cliches you get in most titles nowadays (such as tsunderes, lolis, people screaming baka etc), the directing is pretty stellar with a lot of moments dedicated to breathtaking shots and building atmosphere, there is a nice degree of subtlety and there is no infodumping or scenes where characters are monologuing. The characters themselves feel a bit more human compared to casts in other anime and the plot is filled with suspense. 

Plus if you want a bit of craziness like in Baccano then there's some of that in here as well. Point is that this show despite anime's reputation as an artform nowadays, is actually pretty good so far. I can even see people who dislike anime to find this show rather entertaining.

I remember watching this in the middle of the night while my mom was at work when I was younger maybe around 9-10. Whenever adult swim came on at 8:00PM she would make me turn it off instantly, it would mostly start with King Of The Hill or American Dad, but all the anime would air when she left for work on the weekends (maybe it happened on the weekdays too, but she would be home so I never had the opportunity to watch it).  FLCL made me feel a certain way I couldn't describe and even now it really does feel nostalgic and I really don't know why, and that other feeling I just can't seem to describe. I'm 17 Now. I've literally watched this over and over and over again because its just THAT GOOD. Adult swim is one of the things that really got me into watching anime. It put me onto DBZ Super
I plan on watching flcl soon, I already watched Akira.
Letâ€™s be honest I have no idea whatâ€™s going on in FLCL but man do we love it whoâ€™s with me?
nostalgic, long live flcl

I know that FLCL is just an anime but hereâ€™s some more analytical thinking Nowta represents shyness, kindness, and innocence in one bundle and that is just one of the many characters in this anime may I go on? Also big shout to Kari Walgren for playing Harako good job she was also Foo in Samurai Champloo yeah Iâ€™ve been watching way too much anime no worries I can do this all day
when you used to play diablo 2 on dialup online and you'd hear that opening  of FLCL start and be like BRB FOOLY COOLY's on~

Hope you enjoyed it. If you want more stuff like FLCL then I suggest you look into the studio who made it: Gainax. Every show they make ainâ€™t quite exactly like the atmosphere of FLCL, but theyâ€™re all amazingly unique experiences in their own right. The lively animation, nonsensical writing and extremely likable characters is Gainaxâ€™s signature style.

For some reason, watching FLCL made me feel weirdly nostalgic. It's like how I feel when I imagined what I felt when I was really young and watching cartoons on my small CRT TV. Really confusing, but enjoyable nonetheless

As a 2 year old watching [as] id wake up to the cowboy bepop outro, then watch flcl. Then go to sleep after Big O..
Didnt realise they were real for another 10 YEARS! I though flcl was some fever dream i had as a child!

I didn't watch much of Toonami Midnight run back then especially when they extended it on weeknights because of school and because of church (Friday night before Sabbath) so I never saw the original promo for FLCL.  For most of the 00's I escaped the hype of the anime.  It's only within the last decade where the internet has introduced me to Gainax and its animes, particularly this one.  Even though I only watched it in the 2010s as a rerun on the new Toonami, I could tell it oozes with adolescent nostalgia, I was hooked and was then disappointed with FLCL Progressive

Some anime gives me that feeling to an almost painful degree. A feeling of nostalgia for something I never had. A desperate longing to go somewhere that feels like home that doesnâ€™t exist. Castle in the sky did that to me too. And flcl. Super weird feeling. Very melancholy and kind of intoxicating.

So while there are definitely problematic/inappropriate relationships featured in FLCL (Naota and Mamimi/Naota and Haruko) I would argue that they aren't glorified by the narrative by virtue of them being things that Naota has to overcome that were no longer present in the "end-state" of the show. In other words the fact that Naota is treated unfairly by Mamimi/Haruko is the conflict of FLCL (or at least, a very big part of it.)

Naota and Mamimi's relationship was defined by emotional labour and was framed as being a bad thing for both of them. Mamimi's entire connection to Naota was based on her inability to cope with the loss of Tasuku rather than any genuine interest (sexual or otherwise) in Naota himself. This is why over the course of the series she adopts two other distinct Takkuns, both of which are pets. She was basically using Naota as an emotional support animal and was being extremely inconsiderate in the process, which Naota disliked but chose not to fight back against until he was at his emotional limit due to a sense of responsibility for Mamimi's emotional baggage regarding his brother. I think that the fact that Mamimi is older than Naota was probably meant to extenuate this sense of power imbalance. So while Mamimi's behavior for a lot of the series is really gross and problematic that's an intentional aspect of it, and something that she ultimately has to overcome.

Naota and Haruko's relationship falls into a similar category. Similarly to Mamimi, Haruko had zero interest in Naota but was stringing him along as means to an end. She's basically the closest thing that the show has to a villain; she's a toxic, manipulative person who fills the void left by Tasuku for a bit, but ultimately Naota grows as a person and learns to both stand up for himself, and accept the fact that they just aren't meant to be together.

From a narrative perspective Haruko being older also had a lot to do with Naota's own sense of abandonment/disillusionment toward his older brother. She wasn't just someone that Naota had his first crush on, she was also someone he looked up to, and the fact that he was willing to stand up for himself and eventually say goodbye to her demonstrates his personal growth over the course of the story.

I think the fact that Naota parts with both of these characters (and seemingly winds up with Ninamori iirc, who's far more age appropriate) comes with the implicit message that part of why Mamimi and Haruko weren't right for Naota had to do with the fact that they were older and only tangentially interested in him due to personal shortcomings (Mamimi's inability to deal with abandonment and Haruko's selfish desire for Atomsk respectively.) Thanks for bringing this up btw, it isn't something that I've seen a whole lot of discussion around, and I'm really sorry about any trauma you've experienced in this regard.

I bought the whole show on DVD. The obserdity of people beating the crap out of each other over food in a supermarket that is very cheap because it's about to expire is insanely funny. Not to mention, this is like the disgusting sushi in American supermarkets that taste terrible in comparison to fresh sushi at a sushi restraint. The fights are similar to a dragon ball z fight with no ki. The fight starts every day after the discount almost expired sticker label is placed on the tiny plastic box. It's so obserd fighting over this every day. And that's the appeal to this anime. Also. They refer to it as a sport for honor. Outside the brawls, they are normal, and some rival groups are friends outside the battles. They are only enemies in the supermarket. My favorite line is when friend rivals talk about it so casually. This girl character says to her friend, rival opponents" "Hey. You guys going to the bento brawl today." Lol. It's just a normal thing. I loved it. I bought the only copy I saw online. I searched and when I found it. It said it was the very last copy. ðŸ¤ª to bad for you. Lol.

I loved erased until Kayo left town. The teacher being the only older male in the show that got any screetime did not help
Well I can predict most storylines, so there is no genre of Mystery for me. Its always what happens before the ending that intrigues me, and in my experience ERASED WAS ONE  OF THE AMAZING ONES.

Personally, despite having a reputation in my friend group for not being allowed to watch mysteries with people because I always guess the ending, I never guessed it was Yashiro in Erased, at least not until halfway through. Sure, I always got bad vibes, but I just thought he was a creep or something, not the killer.
I love Erased tbh

I've never seen Erased as a detective or mystery show at all. I was never pulled in by the "who done it" of it, I called the killer in episode 2. Imo its not about the mystery, its about the time meddling. The "what are we gonna do that can domino into a future where no one dies?" is by far the more important and meaningful takeaway from the show. Its the failures that ultimately lead to the one singular timeline in which everyone is saved and the hero is the only victim, that makes it worth watching.

I just finished my marathon of this show and I have to say, it wasn't for me. I hate to be that guy but I just couldn't get into it. It was almost like a task I had to do just to get through it, I definitely liked aspects of it tho, but on a whole it was just average for me. The animation is not the best, but I guess that's not its fault, it's old so I can't trash on it too hard. Not only did I find the main protagonist a little annoying with his "goody two-shoes" don't kill anyone attitude, but the stories relationships were also unresolved. I assume Vash got with Meryl, the insurance girl, but you never find out. Vash loved Rem, Meryl had the same ideology as Rem, Meryl clearly has romantic feelings for Vash, so Vash loves Meryl too maybe? it's kinda hinted that they would hook up in the last couple of episodes, especially the final scene of the credits, but you never find out. So that was extremely disappointing to not have a conclusion for them. Also is Rem even dead? we take it as if she is dead, but I think if the show had got more episodes they would have 100% had an arc were Rem returns because you never actually see her die, but I dunno. Also Legato character was kinda redundant, he was built up to be the "Big bad" of the series throughout most of the show and then just killed off. Vash shoots him in the head and totally contradicts his entire character but whatever. Vash annoyed the shit out of me, how many people died just because he didn't want to kill anyone, then he goes and kills someone. And the show just kinda ended suddenly, like the final episode he fights his brother for a couple of minutes, then he wins and that's it. The End. Like what? also what even are they, plants? why do their arms become cannons? So much shit I didn't get. But maybe that's my fault I dunno, it just wasn't for me. I never like Mad Max and this is like the anime version of that. An apocalyptic sci-fi punk rock anime. Like there are mutants and giants running around and shit. 

Saying all this I did enjoy a lot of the humour, and I liked the fact that no matter how much Vash tried people around him died. It was brutally realistic and It was like he was cursed. It was actually kinda depressing. But I did enjoy a lot of stuff in the show, I didn't hate it, but I was glad when I finished it. 
The movie was absolute dog shit tho, they bring in this cowgirl character that I couldn't give a shit about and they make her the main protagonist. The insurance girls are barely in it, the biggest love interest in the show, Meryl, has less than 5 min screen time. Vash is like a secondary character in it also, the animation was a lot better, but the story sucked and half the voice actors weren't even the same. Also when is that movie even supposed to be in the Trigun Timeline? 

I give the show a 5/10 I know a lot of people like it and fair enough, this is just my personal opinion. There was just too much unresolved shit for me. The ending itself was too sudden, the romantic relationships, Rems fate, Knives fate, who was Tesla, etc etc it all just didn't really have a conclusion, so i dunno it just wasn't for me. Sorry.
Thanks for the memories Trigun, I'm glad I watched you, but I'll never watch you again.
Cya.

Why is Naruto the best anime?
First of all, to all of you who haven't seen everything from Naruto, don't say that this or this anime is the best, just watch everything from Naruto. There was a monster with 10 tails, this lived sealed in a man, this man divided the monster into 9 weaker, different monsters. Naruto got the strongest of the 9 sealed in himself as a baby, his mother and father died (the hero and "king" of the village) in which they lived. From that day on, Naruto felt nothing but contempt. His childhood was one of the worst imaginable. Nobody liked him, he didn't know who his parents were, but he had a dream. He once wanted to be the greatest and most important ninya in the world, but it was difficult for him, he was initially the worst in his class. But he NEVER gave up.
He believed hard in arriving his goal. More than anyone else did. He was then assigned to a team and had his first "friends", and his previous class teacher also respected him. From then on things only went up, he made great progress, he wasn't the smartest, but he always knew a way out- He did everything to protect his friends, his village, his homeland, what he loved. And that although he was only punished with contempt as a child and still by most of the villagers, but things turned out differently. Finally, he got very far in a competition that no one had expected, but it was interrupted by a sudden attack, Finally learned he knew the master of his father, who was not yet known to him (its meaning), who he had to persuade to train him too. The progress could be seen more and more and it got better and better from day to day, until finally the day came when a certain "Pain" destroyed his village and seriously injured a friend of Naruto. He lost control of himself and his monster living in him, which was trying to escape from Naruto's body. But shortly before that happened, he met his father in the subconscious, who informed him that he was Naruto's father and the "king" of him Village (and a hero) was. This was able to bring Naruto back under control Naruto defeated the one who had destroyed the village and has managed to bring the dead villagers back to life with the help of the real self of "Pain". From then on he was the hero of the village and everyone respected him! But it shouldn't have been all. There was a man who wanted to put the 9 monsters back together and literally took almost all the monsters that were sealed in other people. All that was missing was the monster that lived in Naruto and the 8-tailed monster of his friend who had become by then. Because the man didn't get these 2, he started a war to get them. But Naruto managed to take control of the monster and with this strength he tried to stop the man. And how it goes on will show.
I just wanted to suggest how awesome the story of Naruto is. For Naruto, only his friends, his village, and his homeland mattered. and he was ready to do anything for it.And that gave him the strength to get where he is now. That means it should be conveyed, that friends and targets are the most important thing in life. And of course his country.

The moral of the story: If you are a loser in you're team if you were in Naruto's world, you become the strongest and you know that

I just finished my marathon of this show, and to anyone who is considering watching it I say this. Go for it, it's actually a really good anime, not just because there's crazy fight scenes and anime titties. But because the comedy is spot on and the storyline is quite interesting, the other things just add to it. I completed both seasons in 2 days, it was very fun. I give it a nice 7.5/10 and I'm a reasonably harsh critic. I put it on the same level as the anime "Freezing/Freezing Vibration" they are both very similar. I don't know how many people will read this comment since this trailer is 7years old, but if you're looking for something fun and interesting I recommend watching this, tho there is lots of nudity and sometimes it's kinda laughable how unnecessary it is, but still a good anime. I'm sad there is no season 3, but I will keep an eye out just in case it ever returns.
Thanks for the memories Sekirei, it was fun
until we meet again, Farewell.

It's so weird to me that people would draw comparisons to wildly different shows and movies just because they all have "animal people" in them... if Beastars, Zootopia, Aggressive Retsko and Odd Taxi all had human characters, I don't think anyone would be making these comparisons. It's like trying to force a connection between Titanic and One Piece because they both have ships in them. 

I can see a common thread between Beastars and Zootopia, at least, because they both use the "predators vs prey" metaphor... but Odd Taxi and Aggressive Retsko don't, and have completely different stories and tone. It's just a bizarre, surface level comparison.
Don't sleep on odd taxi, op is god tier, plot is god tier and animation is god tier. It has everything.
First Aggretsuko, then Beast Stars, then Brand New Animal, and now ODDTAXI.

Honestly, Odd Taxi and BNA have relatively different art styles too.
Odd Taxi's is more round, and the eyes on male characters are often very simple, typically given simple dots for irises/pupils).

BNA's goes for a different look. While the irises often have less detail for female characters, most male characters are given more detailed eyes than in Odd Taxi.
Canine-aligned characters like Shirou and the canid terrorist in episode 1 are often drawn with more visible lips instead of simple lines (meanwhile such characters in Odd Taxi such as Yamamoto are not given this detail)

Jackie, however, is more akin to Odd Taxi's style than the other characters, even though she's a BNA character.

@rax252 Perhaps the Oku is yet another Back Rooms level, and the Mononoke is its monster?

It all started with the Bakeneko arc of Ayakashi Samurai Horror Tales (the arc is the last 3 episodes). A 12 episode spinoff titled Mononoke was made in 2007. If you liked the movie, the series are a must watch (though I wish we had more episodes, but hey we're getting two more movies in the future as this one is planned as part of a trilogy)
The Mononoke phantom reminds me of a Rez boss
Yes! The Mononoke series uses a similarly beautiful texture layering technique.

When people go to movies, they want to be involved in the picture so that they can get a sense of â€œI want to lose myself up on that screen for a few hoursâ€ and a sense, to know what it's like to be human. Then you come across certain kinds of films that when you go to the theater and when you see them, you're completely taken by surprise. They make you look at life a different way, and they make you look at being human a different way. They touch areas that you don't want touched sometimes. Theyâ€™re provocative, which is good. And then there's that rarest of films, where when you see it continually over years (10, 15, 20, 30, 40 years) you still see more in it. And what's even better is that if you're making pictures, you go back to this well, this source for two reasons: 1.) For inspiration and 2.) To learn. To learn how to make pictures.

Thatâ€™s what it felt like to me when watching Princess Mononoke. Miyazaki is such an incredible storyteller as his films often deal with humanity's relationship with nature and technology, as this film deals with themes of Shinto and environmentalism. Itâ€™s not only more beautifully drawn, it has an extremely complex and adult script and the soul of a romantic epic between Ashitaka and San, and its lush tones, breathtaking score by Joe Hisaishi and full-blooded characterizations give it the sweep of cinema's most grand canvases. It is truly a landmark in the world of animation.
Maturing is realizing that the Monk is the true villain of Princess Mononoke
princess mononoke is a great amine.

When people go to movies, they want to be involved in the picture so that they can get a sense of â€œI want to lose myself up on that screen for a few hoursâ€ and a sense, to know what it's like to be human. Then you come across certain kinds of films that when you go to the theater and when you see them, you're completely taken by surprise. They make you look at life a different way, and they make you look at being human a different way. They touch areas that you don't want touched sometimes. Theyâ€™re provocative, which is good. And then there's that rarest of films, where when you see it continually over years (10, 15, 20, 30, 40 years) you still see more in it. Â @erenjaeger-uy9nsÂ  The thing is I always rate all anime that I've watched 10/10, lol... But yeah, it's worth watching imo... Especially if you're interested in game development... If you decided to watch it and like it, I recommend you to watch SHIROBAKO, it's similar to NEW GAME!, but it's about making anime instead of games...
It's about an 18 year old girl starting her first job as an artist at a game company.

This anime mostly revolves around gaming. It's about a girl name Suzukase Aoba who will work in a game company name Eagle Jump as a character designer. The story will get more and more interesting once you start watching it. If you love gaming, you will definitely love this anime for sure.

People really like to hate needlessly on the original show, as if they intended for it to be as awful as everyone interprets it as. They had like no budget, Hirano's slow ass was taking yonks to get anywhere, they had literally no choice but to go loopy with the plot and, for what it's worth, they could've tied it together if they got a Season 2... They didn't. Alas, this chapter of Hellsing history has gone maligned, misunderstood and unjustly hated for what it is because "Ultimate better"

Ultimate wouldn't exist without the TV Series because it was made in direct response to it being unfinished. They're both good. Quit whining.

Mushishi radiate a kind of serenity and quiet awe for life. It gives peaceful, serene and harmonious vibes. 

1. It reflects non dualistic view of nature: not good vs evil, but a web of coexistence. 

2. It's slow and meditative story, invites reflection instead of adreline, creating calmness. 

3. Natural landscapes like forests, rivers, snow - carry a transient, ephemeral beauty. 

4. It suggests that humans are just one part of a greater whole. Peace comes from acceptance and harmony with nature, not fighting against it.
If you like Mushishi, you should also watch Kino's Journey, similar vibes. Not as slow and wondrous, but just as calm.
It took me 2.5 months to compete mushishi but I'm grateful i watched it when i felt like and didn't rush it. Truly one the the anime of all time. Vibes and unsettling at the same time

Mushishi's something of an aberration in anime. Such a huge departure from the usual story telling formula. Every episode episodic in nature, but never rushed. Episodic in nature but the noticeable feeling of traveling different regions (different climates, people, Mushi, etc) vicariously through Ginko. This is story telling; this is anime.

If you can understand Mushishi, you might be able to understand insect voices as well.

Mushishi radiate a kind of serenity and quiet awe for life. It gives peaceful, serene and harmonious vibes. 

1. It reflects non dualistic view of nature: not good vs evil, but a web of coexistence. 

2. It's slow and meditative story, invites reflection instead of adreline, creating calmness. 

3. Natural landscapes like forests, rivers, snow - carry a transient, ephemeral beauty. 

4. It suggests that humans are just one part of a greater whole. Peace comes from acceptance and harmony with nature, not fighting against it.
If you like Mushishi, you should also watch Kino's Journey, similar vibes. Not as slow and wondrous, but just as calm.
It took me 2.5 months to compete mushishi but I'm grateful i watched it when i felt like and didn't rush it. Truly one the the anime of all time. Vibes and unsettling at the same time

It stuck with me that Mushishi seems to take place in pre-Imperial Japan and Ginko wears western clothes.
Seriously: just looking at dude's sturdy boots and pants tells you he's traveled the world and lives in a limbo between the "before" and "after" time.

I think thereâ€™s no other anime like Mushishi the closest I can think of is â€œKino no Tabiâ€ 

Natsume Yuujinchou also similar to Mushishi but itâ€™s not a traveling anime

Girls' Last Tour, Aria, Haibane Reimei, Violet Evergarden, Majo no Tabitabi, Seirei no Moriboto etc.

I watched the first ep and I don't think it's accident that the light that turned them into stone and senku hair are in the SAME color;
Even senku said behind every accident there is a logical rule.

I felt so bad thinking of all the animals that died because their owners petrified, locking them in houses and what not, with only the slight bonus of no poachers and what have you...if i got turned to stone, i'd probably come out of my shell frothing at the mouth because the sheer anger over the above would've been all that kept me going: the only innocents in this world are toddlers and animals, and whoever's responsible for the Green Wave made INFANTS spend 3700 years screaming in their own heads because they don't know what's going on...yeah, i'd probably be some unholy combination of Senku's desire to re-advance society*----aka recreate the internet----and Tsukasa's rage against the generation before them, hyper-focused on finding out who's responsible *so all the lovely torture instruments i've spent my time re-creating finally have somebody "worthy" of them: i don't even care if it's an accident, because we can never get EVERYBODY back due to how some were smashed or left eternally suffering e.g. at the bottom of the sea in sub-marines or sunken boats, and even if we could there are beautiful if not important things like monuments and records that've rotted, rusted or run out of power and been lost that we can only preserve in memory, because even the holiday photos are probably gone.


And WOW that became a lot deeper than i meant it to!!!

It's about the noblesse Rai, who slept for 820 years and finally woke up recently to find that the world changed completely and is trying to adapt to the modern world. But of course his peaceful life won't last long because the "union" an organization of human researchers/experimenters are looking for the coffin and the noblesse that have been sleeping in it, for research purposes of course. Watch the noblesse awakening ova if you want to understand more, it's on youtube and is only 30mins long. (And you should watch it before starting with ep1). By the way this is a comedy, slice of life, action, supernatural anime. I hope you'll enjoy it !
There is a noblesse awakening with one episode, they are continuing it after a while. Also, they aren't gonna just specifically copy everything that happens in the webtoon.

I love xxxHolic. If I wish to be a great writer and have happy relationships, would I pay a price? What is the best thing to wish for?
i LOVE xXxholic!!! <3
If you like XXXHolic, the studio behind the show has a new kickstarter. Google "kick-heart".

Can anyone tell me what xxxHolic is about because i do. Think hard&harder, listen&understand to what each episode is saying. This anime isnt like hell girl or kuroshitsuji. This anime is in its own catagorie. Before you start judging an anime look at it and get the gist. For those who dont know the gist of xxxHolic is reality and what humans encounter or struggle to do in todays world. It also tells us that we must be opened minded about the world at large or we as humans will remain ignorant.

the anime is sorta non-cannon. it doesn't exactly follow the manga. and plus there are not that many episodes to begin with.. while the manga of tsubasa chronicles and xxxholic both exceed over 170 chapters (equivalent to over 80 episodes of anime) xxxholic really starts to connect with tsubasa until very later so it's hard to watch the anime to understand tsubasa. you have to read the manga itself

actually, you should read xxxholic while reading tsubasa chronicles at the same time because they're sister mangas. you can't understand one fully without reading the other :) (esp after ch 200 in tsubasa chronicles it's impossible to understand the plot unless you read xxxholic)

I love xxxHolic, there is just something about this series that just captures my attention completely. Maybe it is my curiosity, or maybe my fascination with a story of someone who lives in the normal world and yet is drawn into a world within our world, a world of shadows. 

The art style, music, English voice talent, and pacing are also all very good. I just wish they hadn't removed the ties to the other clamp properties, but even without them.. this show is a masterpiece.
I love xxxHolic. If I wish to be a great writer and have happy relationships, would I pay a price? What is the best thing to wish for?
i LOVE xXxholic!!! <3

I'm sorry but CLAMP was the most incredible, unique story writers ever. it's too bad they basically went down after Kobato. Their stories were real magical and felt more shoujo and shoujo anime. Chobits, such a unique, strange, and surreal concept. We don't get creative anime like this. if we do it's always silly or like something wild like chainsaw man or onepunch--nothing wrong with those! Just not my thing. I just miss the magic and huge feelings like, idk. Maybe I'm old and nostalgic.

Magic knight rayearth, tsubasa chronicles, xxxholic, cardcaptor sakura, angelic layer(my favorite anime) I thought ouran host club was clamp but it's not! Either way, man. I just have a hard time finding anime I like now.. ):

The thing about this anime. The drifters are really not the heroes. No one is really "good" even the good guys were thinking why should they even bother to save this world. I mean when you have your main character say "if you cant speak Japanese then you must die" on the first half of episode one. you really are not setting up for a hero. And those characters are from our world, and our world is gray and flawed as fuck. That's why it's so good. It didnt set Hitler as the good guy. Hitler did the most hitler thing by taking a broken people and turning them into an industrial nation that terrorized its neighbours. No one would get upset for that as that's what happened.

Just rewatched the first episode (thanks Crunchyroll-Funimation merger!) and I noticed something. Not to spoil everything, but I love there there is quiet for the entire episode, except for the ambient sounds, and then at the climax of the episode, it explodes at the end with that Banger of a song in the trailer. It felt chatarirtic, liberating, refreshing even.
If you plan to watch the series:
1) Enjoy the ride, because it is wild.
2) Watch each episode at least twice before moving to the next one, for the following reason:
3) Treat Sonny Boy as a gnostic text in form of a seasonal anime, full of mystical and mysterious imagery. Try to decode it not with your mind, but with your soul. Then it will be your soul to understand what it means for your life.
Sonny Boy is a Zen Koan: it f**ks your mind so hard, but only like this you can be enlightened. And try not to be adrift anymore, to save your life a little. In fact, you canâ€™t change the worldâ€¦

â€¦unless you change yourself.

The First Slam Dunk appears to pay tribute to one of the most influential manga ever written and it was done so in a subtle manner.

I dive right into it after I finished the manga and it was so rewarding to see the particular arc (story), still fresh in my mind, animated before my eyes. Direction is delicate and handle the source material with great respect, though unorthodox visual animation may be a matter of preference (a minor factor, at least for me). The swish of the net in the basket every time Mitsui makes a 3 pointer is still resonating in my ears and it's so satisfying. 40 minutes of gameplay, more than 2 hours of runtime, and more than 3 decades of influence.
We must get a Slamdunk Remake fast pacing and no more filler plus good animation it will set fire for sport anime genre
as a person who's not into basketball or read slam dunk at all, i didn't expect this movie to be my favorite anime movie of all time

Inoue said he named it "The First Slam Dunk" because it'll be new audiences "first" experience with Slam Dunk in the modern era, and he wants old fans to feel as if they are meeting Slam Dunk for "the first time", that's why there is a new story in the movie that wasn't in the manga.
Can I watch this without knowing anything about the slam dunk universe?
Seems the animation is  off in my eyes.  I am used to the old slamdunk animation.
yeah.. today's basketball anime, like Fruit Basket or Haikyu, doesn't stand a chance against Slam Dunk

â€¢	"Slam Dunk" is an iconic sports manga by Takehiko Inoue that has become a landmark in both basketball and manga history. First serialized in the early 1990s, the series blends humor, intense action, and character development in a way that captures the excitement of basketball while also delving into the personal growth of its characters.
	â€¢	
	â€¢	The story follows Hanamichi Sakuragi, a high school delinquent who initially joins the basketball team to impress a girl, but soon discovers a deep passion for sport. His transformation from a brash, unskilled rookie to a key player on the team is central to the narrative and provides both comedic and heartfelt moments. Sakuragi is a flawed yet endearing protagonist, whose stubbornness and brash nature make him incredibly relatable. His journey is one of self-discovery, teamwork, and overcoming obstacles, making his growth throughout the series one of its most compelling aspects.
	â€¢	
	â€¢The strength of "Slam Dunk" lies in its vibrant cast of characters. Each team member, from the talented and serious Shohoku captain, Takenori Akagi, to the skilled yet humble Kaede Rukawa, adds depth to the story. The dynamics between themâ€”ranging from rivalry to camaraderieâ€”enhance the emotional stakes of the basketball games and bring a layer of realism to the teamâ€™s development.
	â€¢	
	â€¢	The pacing is strong, especially in the latter half of the series, as the stakes rise during the interhigh tournament. Each match is a thrilling ride, filled with strategic plays, individual brilliance, and moments of team spirit that make the victory feel earned.
	â€¢Ultimately, "Slam Dunk" is more than just a sports mangaâ€”it's a story about growth, friendship, and the power of perseverance. It can resonate with anyone, regardless of their interest in basketball, thanks to its universal themes of self-improvement and teamwork. Whether you're a fan of sports or just a lover of well-crafted stories, "Slam Dunk" is a must-read, offering a perfect blend of humor, heart, and high-flying action.

Charlotte- This anime is absolute awesome. I would recommend this to everyone to take a look at. This is kinda my first sad anime which touched my heart. It could at times make you laugh ,at times serious, at times it could make  you think about life itself .The genera and the story of this is awesome. 
THE ANIMATION, SONG, QUALITY, ETC! BEST EVER!
I LOVE IT VERY VERY MUCH.

But the way the producers made the ending of the first season, Its like all ending. But then also I want to see a next season of this anime to confirm that all memories of Yuu Otosaka gone with plundering the abilities should come back and live a love, happy and peaceful life with Nao Tomori as they promised each other to be lovers forever. 
This would make me the most happy for this anime.

So to confirm this, its a humble request to producers ( those who are watching my comment ) Please make Second season of the Charlotte anime. Yeah many seasons with new ideas would be better but if you guys are thinking of only one then please make a second season confirming the topic said in the previous para.
Please its a humble request from me. Please

I'm currently suffering from depression and life hasn't been going so well, Ergo Proxy is the only media that made me feel calm, made me forget about reality and the struggles for a moment, my mind didn't keep reminding me of bad thoughts while i watched it, i felt immersed in the story and the world around it, i felt in love with the main characters, and even the soundtrack is great idk what were you smoking during this video.

Now yeah, the anime definitely isn't perfect, while i felt like my head needed something slow and i didnâ€™t had any problem with how slow paced the first like 8 episodes were, i can see why they didnâ€™t gave a good impression to most people, the biggest problem the entire anime has is the pacing, it feels slow paced but it feels rushed at the same time, there's just so many world building details that could have been done better if it had more time on it, i didnâ€™t really care about Quinn character and her death because she barely had any significant scene, i didn't felt really sad with Hoody death because we don't know much about his past with Romdeau, i was already expecting him to die at some point, but i felt so frustrated with how quick it was. And then there is the final episodes that felt so rushed, we didnâ€™t need to see the trio getting to Romdeau i think it was fine just showing what happened after it, but the whole "revelation" of the ending just felt so fast, it only gave me the impression that the studio didnâ€™t had enough budget to use all the potencial the writer had. 

But overall, the funny thing is, i barely know much about philosophy, i only recognized some of the most popular basic latin references, that i studied some few years ago, so i can't tell how much i missed and how in depth it truly is.

Ergo proxy is for those who can understand the literature that forms the basis of its premise and message. 

And even those without it, they find themselves drawn back to it again and again for some reason because there is something about the show that nags them. Something deeply hidden under the visuals and the slow pace and the, for the surface level watcher, pretentious dialogue. And then once they peel back the layers they realize, this show was never about a post apocalyptic dystopia.. it was about self discovery and self denial and the consequences of both. It was always a journey inward.. an invitation to explore the mind.

Vincent laws journey started with him going out to find himself, the truth behind his memories and lack of them. His journey eventually found him returning to the very place he wanted to run away from.. and his final confrontation was with an exact mirror image of himself, the one he was trying to deny. His denial of himself left the city of Rondo in a state of decay and stasis, and his departure left it to die as the humans began to slowly lose their minds with the absense of meaning. When he rediscovered himself he was faced with a choice, to embrace his reason for being, the purpose he was made to fulfill, or to reject it, or to find another path and reintegrate his past self into his present, more mature whole. His denial of himself made his past self resentful and it lashed out in unpredictable ways, going as far as to kill the one that facilitated its erasure and suppression in a bitter bid of vengeance. 

This is the Jungian shadow and the fool. Vincent was the fool, but also he became the wise old man as a result of his journey of blind naivety. And finally when he opened his eyes in the end, they glow with the incandescence of enlightenment, having accepted himself.

Texhnolyze is an under appreciated masterpiece

I've just finished this show, and I can safely say I dislike it! [Spoiler free review]

Texhnolyze has many plotlines that do not fully get resolved, and doesn't make very good use of the promising and mysterious narrative elements it begins itself with. What begins as a surreal philosophical science fiction mystery devolves into a moody gangster 'drama' that has little redemption.

 The characters are written well, and the setting in which they play is interesting and original. I enjoyed the dark themes and how they are handled most of the time as well. But the 'villains,' if you will, have truly vapid motivations and offer nothing but chaos as a means to progress the plot. Chaos and decay are central themes in Texhnolyze, but all of its other themes are handled so much more smartly and serve its characters better. There are ultimately no answers as to why things happen in Texhnolyze, in a grand sense, other than 'villains decided to do villainous things because human nature.'

As for my personal taste, while I was hooked by the surrealism and mystery during the first few episodes, I very slowly came to be bored and then frustrated with the show. I say frustrated, because while the narrative doesn't spiral out of control, it just gets not good after about halfway through the show; things still make enough sense for the ideas to remain cohesed, yet the ideas lose their light; the narrative doesn't become unenjoyable suddenly, but rather very gradually. I also found the ending rather unsatisfying, but I don't consider that to be a fault in the show's writing necessarily. 

I had a lot of hope for this show and Texhnolyze sets itself up so well, but slowly lost me by the end. I have seen some people compare this to Ergo Proxy, which I thoroughly enjoyed, and which delivered on its premises satisfactorily. 

I know I'm being negative, but I wanted to write out a negative review as fairly as possible without any spoilers.
Texhnolyze my top 10

Texhnolyze was made by the same studio and director as Shigurui, and both series have some similarities.  There's very little dialogue but great music; the pacing is slow and imagery is tangential, but the action scenes are quick, dynamic, and brutal.  Strongly recommended.

This is the anime that finally got the respect, praise and recognition it deserves today. Fanservice, action, comedy, violence, adventure, and provocative content is all a perfect mix of a classic 21st century mature animated japanese show. People then in person, online or virtually was not expecting a show like this ebcause they are introverted americans that never seen anime that is not for children. They hated the show for no reason by critics that want sympathy on tv or internet. There is more to Fairty Tail than meets the eye. It's a compeling and entertining anime that is relatable and fun especially for adults.

Everyone is used to the expected "vanilla endings," where, regardless of the protagonist's circumstances, the story always ends on a happy note. However, the author of "OSHI NO KO" has the audacity to offer a unique ending that serves as a fitting conclusion to the narrative. You feel anger because you realize that this is how the story was supposed to end. The author achieved the response he had hoped for, so use your head, friends, and don't be guided by false conclusions based on other works. Good luck to all!

This comment originally posted yesterday night before FUCKING YOUTUBE'S CONSTANT UNFAIR REMOVAL FORCED ME TO DO THE ENTIRE REPOSTING ALL FUCKING OVER AGAIN! Now it's been reposted & now re-edited just to hopefully no more Youtube's cruelty ever again.
I really hated Youtube's unfair removal. I'm trying to express my sadness upon Yushi Suzuki's untimely death. The reason why I'm expressing this was because I've watched Eden Zero on Netflix at September 14th & 15th. I loved it. I'll be patient for another season on Netflix in the near future. It's just too bad that one of the creators of the animated adaptation have died in an untimely manner. As a result, the future of Eden Zero animated adaptation will change for better or worst. But I digress. If you want to know about Yushi Suzuki's passing, just look it up on the internet through the search engine. You'll see what I meant. May you rest in peace, Yushi Suzuki. NOW LET ME KEEP MY COMMENTS HERE, YOU GODDAMN YOUTUBE! LET ME KEEP MY COMMENTS HERE! I'M TELLING YOU TO STOP BEING CRUEL TO MY COMMENTS EVER FUCKING AGAIN! Judging by the voices, it sounds to me like they're bringing back Tia Ballard as Happy, (which I am very excited for!) also sounds like Mother is gonna be voiced by Colleen Clinkenbeard, (hope she voices Elsie as well) 
Rebecca sounds like Erica Lindbeck, and Pino sounds like Faye Mata who voices Aqua in "Konosuba" and March in "To Your Eternity".
Also, according to the comment section, people are saying that Shiki is gonna be voiced by Sean Chiplock, who voiced Subaru Natsuki in Re. Zero. (which is a really good choice for Shiki!)
But I can't tell who's voicing Weisz and Homura. But other than that, I'm really looking forward to seeing this when it hits Netflix!! ðŸ˜ðŸ˜ðŸ˜ðŸ˜

My man Sean Chiplock getting the recognition he deserves. Loved his performance as Subaru Natsuki in Re:ZERO, absolutely killed it (many times over), so hearing him as Shiki here was a very welcome surprise. Also hearing Tia Ballard as Happy was nice. I've been thinking of watching this since I've heard lots of good things about it, especially it apparently being better than Fairy Tail. I personally loved Fairy Tail's lore and characters, but really despised the plot holes, plot armor, character revivals and fan service, all (almost) things I've heard have been majorly nerfed in Edens Zero. I also love sci-fi and space, so that could be another reason for me to watch it.

and, at that moment, bocchi became THE ROCK!!!!

Bocchi the Rock is like a quiet emotional mirror for people whoâ€™ve been carrying heaviness for a long time. It dresses its sadness in color and comedy, but it never denies that sadness â€” it integrates it.

The shoegaze tones, the awkward humor, the saturated pastel cityscapes â€” all of it says, â€œYou can be broken and still play your music.â€ Thatâ€™s what makes it so healing. Bocchi isnâ€™t â€œfixedâ€ by the end; sheâ€™s just a little more connected, a little more able to exist in the same world that once terrified her.

Weâ€™re seeing our own melancholy reflected through something that makes it feel bearable, maybe even beautiful. Thatâ€™s what good art does - it doesnâ€™t erase the painâ€¦ it turns it into texture.
Protect the OG Bocchi fans at all costs

If I would describe an anime that changed my life, it would be obviously Bocchi the Rock.
But being more specific, EP 8 completely changed my life forever, it was the beginning of my passion about guitars, and being more passionate about music in general. The people I met because of it, and all the journey I went just because of a single 2 minutes song inside an anime...
Am i tweaking or did they deleted the last part of bocchiâ€™s solo

One thing I love in the few music animes I've seen is when the musicians challenge eachother. You have to know you fellow musicians well, but you have to be able to push yourself to the bleeding edge. For one reason or another it seems as, if not more impactful in these shows. Bochii might be playing normally, but she still has to accommodate her band... and to that end her band has to accommodate and work with her style, while pushing themselves to the limit of what they can do personally. You can especially see it with Kita, and how she needs to watch Bocchi play. The instruments need to fight , but the band needs to reign them into a cohesive sound.


Also, those 2 fans deserve the world, and that 15k yen (I think that was the amount) admission to the band's fan club waved.

The shock factor of 1st time watching Bocchi going berserk gave me goosebumps and made me nervous like crazy, but then the whole band joins in seamlessly and cooked so good. 

Who ever wrote the show is a genius in music, storytelling and humor ðŸ”¥
If you like seeing musicians challenging eachother, you are going to love "Rock is a Lady's Modesty"

Bocchi the Rock is like a quiet emotional mirror for people whoâ€™ve been carrying heaviness for a long time. It dresses its sadness in color and comedy, but it never denies that sadness â€” it integrates it.

The shoegaze tones, the awkward humor, the saturated pastel cityscapes â€” all of it says, â€œYou can be broken and still play your music.â€ Thatâ€™s what makes it so healing. Bocchi isnâ€™t â€œfixedâ€ by the end; sheâ€™s just a little more connected, a little more able to exist in the same world that once terrified her.

Weâ€™re seeing our own melancholy reflected through something that makes it feel bearable, maybe even beautiful. Thatâ€™s what good art does - it doesnâ€™t erase the painâ€¦ it turns it into texture.
Protect the OG Bocchi fans at all costs

Â @14ZmargaritaÂ  Banana Fish is based from a manga in the 80s by Akimi Yoshida. Be warned because it's not for the faint of heart, as it tackles real life issues like gang crimes, pedophilia, corruption, rape, and drugs. The main character is Ash Lynx (Aslan Callenreese) a 17 year old gang leader. He was a victim of CSA and was involved with the Mafia at a young age after he had ran away from home. The so-called banana fish in the anime is a kind of mind-controlling drug that causes a person to be gravely afflicted with nightmares and fears to the point of murdering others. The show is basically about Ash and his gang chasing after (or being chased by) the Mafia, and trying to put a stop on banana fish.

Anime about the military, ex military, criminals seeking out hidden Ainu's gold. The gold was hidden by a high profile person who was in a prison. He drew parts of map on the backs of some convicts(i forgot how many). So the main plot, people are hunting these released convicts, to kill them, and to skin their back so that they can assemble the map leading to the hidden gold. It may have comedic moments however in truth the story is really good. Its have mystery, actions, violence, gore, and weird shits. Also cooking and Ainu's culture

I just finished my marathon of this show for the third time and I have to say the following... (Spoilers) 
What a weird show. I watched it for the first time in 2016, then 2017 and now a third time in 2019. Yet I'm still left with a feeling of "What did I just watch" Now obviously the animation and voice acting are top notch, but to be honest I'm not even sure I like the show. But for some reason I've watched it 3 times. Maybe it's boredom that brings me back, or maybe I relate to the characters ideologies of "come waste your life with us" and I identify with that, but it's hard to explain why I watched this show 3 times. The characters aren't even friends, but they are at the same time. There is a sense of love for each other, but it's so deep down that none of them will ever admit it to one another, and you start to think to yourself maybe they don't love each other. They're all so selfish, and I guess that's the point, they care for each other but don't really at the same time. I like the fact that this anime isn't a clichÃ© "We're a family now" kinda thing. CB is more realistic when it comes to personal relationships and displaying emotion. It's a great anime, but I don't even know if I'd recommend it to people, because I don't even understand it myself. It also has a tragic ending, the final scenes of the characters are sad and depressing. Jet is left in a depressed state cleaning his ship, Faye is left totally alone crying, and Spike losses Julia and goes off to die. People say he might be alive, but the show has ended, it's not coming back and the director said he personally believes Spike died (and so do I) It's like "wtf" I just watched 26 episodes of these guys together, including a 2 hour movie that takes place between episodes 22-23, and it ends with these guys alone and broken. I'm pretty sure I don't really like this show, but there's something about it that I really DO like. Maybe it's spikes thoughts on death, or Jet's firmness, or Faye's free spirit attitude I dunno. Something draws me in, but I'm not even sure I like the way it makes me carry that weight. It's so weird. But I guess whatever happens, happens 
Thanks for the memories Cowboy Bebop, I don't think I'll ever watch you again, but I might I dunno. 
Until we meet again.....

Bang.

What I am about to say require a bit of context: I am a Mass Comm student and in one of my classes we had an assignment where we had to find a "new" show to put on a tv station. Can't, for the life of me, remember what the station was. It could be any show that wasn't in syndication or already showing on TV. I struggled, but couldn't think of anything (I don't watch alot of TV, not alot of shows interest me). So I passed the time watching anime when I had a lightbulb, why not use an anime. It was a long shot and required some thought, the station was for a more mature audience, not teens or kids so nothing that "looked cutesy" because I knew that it would get greenlit over the CEO'S dead body (we didn't HAVE to put as much thought as I was into it, but I do better at imagining the full scenario). So I needed a serious anime that had a fair amount of action and drama that people could sink their teeth into. The anime also needed to age well as not everyone is for the "dated but serviceable" shows. That's when it hit me like the Bebop coming out of a warpgate. Why not Cowboy Bebop. I showed a trailer, wrote a quick synopsis and background if the show, pitched it to the class (serving as the metaphorical Board of Directors). Needless to say...I aced that shit.

It was a long shot and required some thought, the station was for a more mature audience, not teens or kids so nothing that "looked cutesy" because I knew that it would get greenlit over the CEO'S dead body (we didn't HAVE to put as much thought as I was into it, but I do better at imagining the full scenario). So I needed a serious anime that had a fair amount of action and drama that people could sink their teeth into. The anime also needed to age well as not everyone is for the "dated but serviceable" shows. That's when it hit me like the Bebop coming out of a warpgate. Why not Cowboy Bebop. I showed a trailer, wrote a quick synopsis and background if the show, pitched it to the class (serving as the metaphorical Board of Directors). Needless to say...I aced that shit.

I just finished my marathon of this show for the third time and I have to say the following... (Spoilers) 
What a weird show. I watched it for the first time in 2016, then 2017 and now a third time in 2019. Yet I'm still left with a feeling of "What did I just watch" Now obviously the animation and voice acting are top notch, but to be honest I'm not even sure I like the show. But for some reason I've watched it 3 times. Maybe it's boredom that brings me back, or maybe I relate to the characters ideologies of "come waste your life with us" and I identify with that, but it's hard to explain why I watched this show 3 times. The characters aren't even friends, but they are at the same time. There is a sense of love for each other, but it's so deep down that none of them will ever admit it to one another, and you start to think to yourself maybe they don't love each other. They're all so selfish, and I guess that's the point, they care for each other but don't really at the same time. I like the fact that this anime isn't a clichÃ© "We're a family now" kinda thing. CB is more realistic when it comes to personal relationships and displaying emotion. It's a great anime, but I don't even know if I'd recommend it to people, because I don't even understand it myself. It also has a tragic ending, the final scenes of the characters are sad and depressing. Jet is left in a depressed state cleaning his ship, Faye is left totally alone crying, and Spike losses Julia and goes off to die. People say he might be alive, but the show has ended, it's not coming back and the director said he personally believes Spike died (and so do I) It's like "wtf" I just watched 26 episodes of these guys together, including a 2 hour movie that takes place between episodes 22-23, and it ends with these guys alone and broken. I'm pretty sure I don't really like this show, but there's something about it that I really DO like. Maybe it's spikes thoughts on death, or Jet's firmness, or Faye's free spirit attitude I dunno. Something draws me in, but I'm not even sure I like the way it makes me carry that weight. It's so weird. But I guess whatever happens, happens 
Thanks for the memories Cowboy Bebop, I don't think I'll ever watch you again, but I might I dunno. 
Until we meet again.....

What I am about to say require a bit of context: I am a Mass Comm student and in one of my classes we had an assignment where we had to find a "new" show to put on a tv station. Can't, for the life of me, remember what the station was. It could be any show that wasn't in syndication or already showing on TV. I struggled, but couldn't think of anything (I don't watch alot of TV, not alot of shows interest me). So I passed the time watching anime when I had a lightbulb, why not use an anime. It was a long shot and required some thought, the station was for a more mature audience, not teens or kids so nothing that "looked cutesy" because I knew that it would get greenlit over the CEO'S dead body (we didn't HAVE to put as much thought as I was into it, but I do better at imagining the full scenario). So I needed a serious anime that had a fair amount of action and drama that people could sink their teeth into. The anime also needed to age well as not everyone is for the "dated but serviceable" shows. That's when it hit me like the Bebop coming out of a warpgate. Why not Cowboy Bebop. I showed a trailer, wrote a quick synopsis and background if the show, pitched it to the class (serving as the metaphorical Board of Directors). Needless to say...I aced that shit.

Normally I hate dubs since the actors never seem to fit the character, but these actors aren't half bad. Love this manga/anime enough that when I was in Japan back in April 2023 I made a 2 day side trip to Hirosaki and rented a bike to visit the Flying Witch locations.
In the words of Mohamed Enieb: this >>>>> wondering witch
OMG I DIDNT KNOW THAT THW FLYING WITCH HAD AN ENGLISH DUB!?!?!?!?!?!???! THIS IS ONE OF MY FAV ANIME OMG!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! YOU DID THIS SO WELL OMG!!!!
a good dub? since when do we have that kind of witchcraft?

The guy and his little sister are kind of spot on with their given characters when compared to the originals.
The liquor girl and her coarse voice, while different compared to the original, actually matches her character quite well.
The witch though... While I'm not familiar with the voice actress I cannot shake the idea of a 30+ woman impersonating a teen.

/me does not like.

It's the most beautiful Anime ever. 
Relaxing and adorable.

It's one suprise after another but without stress of big plots like Kamikaze Lemming said.

I hope they make another season.
Season 2 of the flying witch will make alot of fans very happy.
Especially me.

It's rare to see something holesome and pure been created in a world so broken.

We need more Anime like this.

Well, it's not the first time something's "more X" than Gurren Lagann. For example, did you know that there's actually a giant mecha even more powerful than the Tengen Toppa Gurren Lagann? It's the Demonbane from the game and anime of the same name.
At full power, it can summon every Demonbane that was, is, will be, wasn't, isn't, won't be and can't be (i.e. pretty much infinity+1 copies of itself) and is by itself about as powerful as the TTGL or Grand Zamboa.
what's gurren lagann

I realize what you are saying but if AniplexUSA are the only ones selling it and it manages to make my jaw drop harder than Gurren Laggan than I will buy this regardless of if it is a rip-off.

If anything I can only hate Aniplex for being smart when it comes to marketing, they grab titles they know people are gonna go bonkers over and be willing to spend an ungodly amount of money to obtain the series.
Maybe it's because they don't want to show it off too early and kill the competition before Autumn 2013 starts. :3
There was Trigger logo. Old Gainax staffs who are original creators of Evangelion and Gurren Lagann.
Aniplex licensing Kill la Kill is the worst thing that could have happened to it. $120+ for a series is just not good. Shame because I was super hyped for this. RIP Kill la Kill NA sales

Brilliant and criminally underappreciated series. (What's worse is that people can just binge-watch it, now, which makes it way less likely that you'll appreciate how perfectly structured all the little hints and foreshadowing and internal parallels are.) One of my absolute favorites.
This is just tooooooooo underrated

Â @hmm2928Â  Heh...my friends and I have written, like, 30 pages apiece about this stuff, in forum threads. That said, it's been a while since I last saw it, so it's not super-fresh in my head. (I've been wanting to re-watch it, though. Again. For the fifth time.)

But here's one example: 

At the start of Ep 5, the teacher says that, though they only have one month left, they're going to switch where everyone is sitting. The class grumbles and says, ""it's fine to stay where we are, why change at this point."

Which is basically the show broadcasting what eventually becomes the theme of the whole thing: it's a story that comes with history (since each character is previously tied to some of the others in the group), with concern that the past will lose its significance in the face of an impending future, constantly caught between the known and the unknown--and fraught with the fear that, at any moment, status quo will become stagnation and change will become chaos. (Wait for change and miss you chance VS. take a shot and ruin what you have.)

Or, on a more grounded note, there's this: basically the first shot of the show is Mio playing with an eraser. Which...talk about great foreshadowing. 

Those aren't parallels, of course, but just quick examples of hints and details I could grab from memory.
Â @justusrivera8677Â  do you know any similar anime*

Â @LorsoGaursÂ  I'm going to rudely interject: Tsuki ga Kirei is a great series to watch as a companion piece to Just Because. It's different, but you should immediately feel how they are both cut from the same cloth: grounded, romance-focused, character-driven, show-don't-tell storytelling with no cliches, filler, or reliance on typical anime rom-dram conventions.
Â @justusrivera8677Â  ok no problem
Â @justusrivera8677Â  thank you
Â @interregnum_Â  any other similar? I watched Tsuki and got bored but sat through till the end which was good but nowhere near Just Because for me

Â @iGotIceInMyRice-s1yÂ  It depends on what you want from your experience, if you're looking for things that are similar-ish (and I stress "-ish"), so...here's a short list of potential potentials: Toradora, Scum's Wish, Pet Girl of Sakurasou, After the Rain, Waiting in the Summer, Glasslip, True Tears, Ground Control to Psychoelectric Girl, and Kiznaiver. I think they've all got something that I'd compare to why I like Just Because, but some are lighter or darker or weirder or artsy-er. Check out the blurbs for each. Hopefully, one or two suits your fancy.

Which is basically the show broadcasting what eventually becomes the theme of the whole thing: it's a story that comes with history (since each character is previously tied to some of the others in the group), with concern that the past will lose its significance in the face of an impending future, constantly caught between the known and the unknown--and fraught with the fear that, at any moment, status quo will become stagnation and change will become chaos. (Wait for change and miss you chance VS. take a shot and ruin what you have.)

Or, on a more grounded note, there's this: basically the first shot of the show is Mio playing with an eraser. Which...talk about great foreshadowing. 

Those aren't parallels, of course, but just quick examples of hints and details I could grab from memory.
Â @justusrivera8677Â  do you know any similar anime*

Â @LorsoGaursÂ  I'm going to rudely interject: Tsuki ga Kirei is a great series to watch as a companion piece to Just Because. It's different, but you should immediately feel how they are both cut from the same cloth: grounded, romance-focused, character-driven, show-don't-tell storytelling with no cliches, filler, or reliance on typical anime rom-dram conventions.
Â @justusrivera8677Â  ok no problem
Â @justusrivera8677Â  thank you
Â @interregnum_Â  any other similar? I watched Tsuki and got bored but sat through till the end which was good but nowhere near Just Because for me

Â @iGotIceInMyRice-s1yÂ  It depends on what you want from your experience, if you're looking for things that are similar-ish (and I stress "-ish"), so...here's a short list of potential potentials: Toradora, Scum's Wish, Pet Girl of Sakurasou, After the Rain, Waiting in the Summer, Glasslip, True Tears, Ground Control to Psychoelectric Girl, and Kiznaiver. I think they've all got something that I'd compare to why I like Just Because, but some are lighter or darker or weirder or artsy-er. Check out the blurbs for each. Hopefully, one or two suits your fancy.

Patrick: VINLAND!

Vinland Saga is the best Netflix series you've probably never heard of. Admittedly I came for the animation, but stayed for the tears. NEVER has anime moved me the way this show did; and on reflection, my emotional reaction to the series only once before occurred in a series you might  have heard ofâ€”Game of Thrones. But that was a story featuring living, breathing actors, based on a collection of books written by the incomparable George RR Martin. Like in Martin's tale, the characters in Vinland are fleshed out in such a way that though they are not real, though they are mere moving images drawn both by hand and computer, eventually your brain forgets that, and suddenly its protagonist Thorfinn becomes as real as Kit Harrington's Jon Snow, as real as his father Thors becomes as real as Snow's "father," Sean Bean's Eddard Stark. A remarkable feat that will stay with me until my last breath. I am eagerly awaiting season 2, which reportedly will be released January 2023.

The reason so many anime stories revolve around the period of time that is High School is actually for the exact same reason they keep transporting Peter Parker back into that age whenever they reboot or spin-off Spider-Man:  it's a period of time that literally EVERY SINGLE VIEWER is going to have in common.  It's the most universal of experiences.  Is your character an effed-up adult mercenary?  Who's going to like that person?  You'll end up liking them if you end up liking them, but you won't have anything in common with them to help bridge that gap.  I mean, hell, the way they made you forgive John Wick for murdering hundreds and hundreds and hundreds of people while saying less than 40 words over the course of a 4-movie franchise (well, 5 if you include Ballerina) is that they gave him a pet... people love and identify with pets.  People identify easily with High School.

Oh, also, Japan doesn't really have "creative" things.  I'm not trying to be controversial, I'm just saying everything is far more corporatized and owned than people seem to realize.  You're favorite J-Pop/J-Metal/J-Rock band was 100%, no questions asked, do not at me, built by committee.  Your favorite manga?  Guarantee it passed through 3 or 4 editors who gave "this is non-negotiable" edits to those stories and characters.  Things like manga and music and anime are PRODUCTS meant to generate money, period.  If you like them?  Then cool.  There were creatives who were very passionate and proud that - of all the works that got looked at by teams upon teams of editors - that THEIR creative thing got picked.  That one part of your favorite series that makes absolutely no sense to the entire fanbase and pisses them off and flies in the face of everything the creator said?  Yeah, probably from the editors and money-men.  Not a joke.  Not an exaggeration.  The Black Zetsu in Naruto being some last-second "But really, I was responsible for everything, and the real villain isn't Madara, the guy we've built up for most of the series!  It's this rando over here"?  That part?  Yeah, they were doing a sequel whether Kishimoto was in or not.  So then they told him "you have to bridge your series with what we're already planning on doing."  Ta-da!  Momoshiki!  Out of fucking NOWHERE!  Hope you all enjoy!  Oh, did this author just pitch a series that involves an adult character going on an adventure in this world with a younger action-oriented protagonist?  Nope!!  She's getting aged down to a teen girl!  So all the boys can like her!  And we're putting her in short-shorts/a skirt for good measure!  Oh, you thought your drama, slice-of-life series was going to be about adult friends who are struggling with life as young adults, and one of them becomes so depressed they walk out in front of a car?  NOPE!  You instead get HIGH SCHOOLERS who do basically this exact same thing, but oddly act and feel like adults, with the caveat being "their in their senior year, so they're more mature!"  (that's the series Orange if you didn't pick up on it).  Why?  Because Shonen makes money.  Because Shonen makes the MOST money.  Because Shonen makes the most money when the characters are young and have to go to some kind of school.

Hell, even Harry Potter is just "an anime about kids going to magic school - it ends when they graduate after defeating the evil main villain".  Spider-Man turned into an adult, and they decided NOT to morph Peter back into a teen?  Bring out Miles!  Who's a teen!  Oh, we're letting Miles age up?  Bring out a new version of Gwen Stacey!  She's a Spider-Woman now!  And a teen!  Oh, is she aging out now?  Better make up some wild shit about her getting merged into the standard Marvel universe and get aged down AGAIN!  Naruto became an adult?  End it!  It's now about his teen son!  Bleach reached it's climax and the main characters can now become adults?  Nope!  Hint off at their kids being new protagonists!  Fullmetal Alchemist has Edward as an adult?  End it, quick!  Even Attack on Titan ends with the characters BARELY being adults!  This is just... the DUMBEST form of media, but it's also the most popular, so... you take it with it's flaws, or you don't.

As someone who's been tortured in my life and have smelled the stench of burning human flesh, I can tell you with certainty that this anime delves deeper into the exploration of the intimacy of inflicting suffering than anything I've ever seen before. This show is mostly horror but it devotes a significant portion of time to people doing bad things to other people. There are three kinds of torturers. There's the professional who does it for god and country. There is the sadist who does it for the sheer sexual ecstasy of it. And then there's the intimate torturer who does it for the human connection it gives them. This show shows the latter in at least once instance. It's pretty sick and twisted but also rather enlightening. To this day I can't tell you what I think of the show. For one, the author loves to indulge in the display of bodily functions as well as various taboos. I suspect he/she rates rather high on the dark triad. But I can also see a lot of humanity in the anime so in the end, hell if I know.
Lyzra is problably still alive but stuck deep in the abbys beacuse she can't go back up or go deeper to risk worse curses

When she started bleeding from every hole i thought she was gonna die, i was not expecting that, given the happy airy light the show gave off starting out, snd then when bondrews actions and what he did. This show is cruel, but its good writing. And what makes it a 1000x harder is that unlike other animes these are unmistakably children that are suffering horribly before our eyes.

I was only 4 years old in 1992. This show takes me back to wanting to be a big kid with as many coins for arcade machines as I want. 
The emotions of the characters were just so real and raw. Absolutely amazing how they get us to care so much about who wins a video game battle. It could be based on their love for another character or a character's self-esteem, or their general psychological health. They always manage to put serious stakes on the outcome of video game battles that left me having to know who wins.
Even with the massive amount of choice on Netflix and other streaming services, I watched this all the way through. Absolutely loved it. Thank you to the creator.

I think the story aspect of World Trigger is it's weakest part. I'm not there for the story, I'm there for the unending tournament arc of smart characters using their abilities in a smart way. Unlike all other shounen. 
So the best trailer for this show would actually be the fight of top 4 attackers vs neighbors of S2. It doesn't spoil anything important, and I think it's the best fight we got in the series so far. Instant hook for anyone IMO.

Since they announce season 2, hopefully toei can give toonami the rights to the series and air world trigger. Possibly before season 2 airâ€™s.

The manga did exceptionally well actually; the anime was kind of a failure though, its not all bad, just mostly. Of course you most likely don't buy manga as it serializes in Japan, so i don't know if you actually care about the sale #s of shonen jump. But it does determine a lot at the series level. 

The three things that have been most damaging to World Triggers success are Toei, The Writer's Health (as it limits the amount of content that can be put out), and lastly the content. For example, right now in the manga a character Hyuse battles several Border agents that are fairly formidable; he beats them in varying degrees 5 to 1, 5 to 0, 5 to 4; but you never see the fights just the scores of the combat simulation. Then another thing is they start story lines that they may never finish like one squad is on the verge of falling apart and they get 3 or 4 chapters of story and then just vanish. They detail this huge world, and make it so immersive, but as it is just a manga you can't always get the information that you want.

Well, in my opinion the voice for Jin could have been a bit better, the voice actor for Kuga is fine.
